intro: Psychotria salticola, commonly known as the jumping psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, waxy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, attracting various pollinators. Psychotria salticola is also known for its psychoactive properties, containing alkaloids such as dimethyltryptamine (DMT).
